alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 29 at 5:53PM MDT until June 29 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected, especially for Crooks Creek and Sheep Creek south of Jeffery City. * WHERE...A portion of central Wyoming, including the following county, Fremont. * WHEN...Until 945 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Rises and flooding along small streams and normally dry arroyos. Dangerous and fast flows over low-water crossings in the steep terrain near Crooks Gap. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 550 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause small stream flooding, especially for Crooks Creek and Sheep Creek south of Jeffery City. Between 0.75 and 1.75 inches of rain have fallen. Moderate to heavy rain currently continues in the area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Arapohoe Creek, Lankin Creek, Spring Creek, Cottonwood Creek, Diamond Springs Draw, Bare Ring Slough, Sheep Creek, West Fork Crooks Creek, East Cottonwood Creek, Crooks Creek, Sweetwater River, Cooper Creek, East Fork Middle Cottonwood Creek and O`Brien Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jeffrey City, Crooks Gap and Split Rock.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
